website_summaries.verdict: Not the best pick for long-distance or heavy-duty use, but practical and affordable for families on trips or kids who are learning to use two-way radios.
pros: Compact and easy to use, even for youngsters
A good choice for family outings or short-distant excursions
Compatible with some other types of two-way radios
cons: Not likely to live up to the 16-mile range, especially around walls and other objects
Requires 3 AAA batteries per radio, and battery life could be better

customer_reviews.title: Disable the call tone
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are very high-quality. The range is extremely short, but perfect for my young kids to play with around the house and yard. Disable the ringing call tone with a small piece of tape and your sanity will stay intact too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Made the caravan road trip so easy!
customer_reviews.text: I got these so that my fiancee and I could communicate with each other in separate cars moving to a new city. They worked great. Good sound quality, easy to use. I used the included clip to clip it to the seat belt and I was able to easily provide directions and keep up with when we needed to stop. We drove about 6 hours and these lasted the whole trip! I put batteries in when I got them and we tested them about 2 days before we left. We were driving through desert in the middle of the night and through city in the very early morning. I'm very pleased with these and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good range, good battery life
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has lots of fun with these, and my wife and I use them if we need to coordinate turning switches on and off around the house or if one of us needs occasional help during a home improvement project. I tested these in a suburban environment and I got about 4 blocks away before the signal gave out. Plenty of houses in between and power lines are not buried so lots of interference.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as an intercom
customer_reviews.text: Almost as good as an intercom! Inside we use them when everyone is in a different part of the house and, outside, we use them to keep track of each other.
customer_reviews.author: B's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Motorola T100 Talkabout Radio-2 Pack
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product, Motorola T100 Talkabout Radios, 2 pack. We could not open the battery compartment. My son, daughter and I tried to get it opened as stated in the instructions. My son is 50 and is an engineer and has had walkie talkies. He could not believe you couldn't open the battery compartment. I just laughed and shipped them back for a refund. I will look for Talkies with a charging system next time. Perhaps we received a pair that were defective. Not sure!?
customer_reviews.author: MsKitti

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst. Batteries die within 2 days. You can’t charge them cause there is no access for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute little guys
customer_reviews.text: I haven't opened them yet.. Just wanted to throw up a "real life" photo. I'm 6' tall.. Normalish size hands. The T100TPs are tiny. Cute even.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love These Radios!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t say enough good about these radios. Work week and great range. Used to communicate between 2 cars on a cross country move. Battery life isn’t great, maybe 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: RANDY J.

customer_reviews.title: Dropped it 1200 feet. Still works.
customer_reviews.text: I took these up the El Capitan in Yosemite climbing. The third day we had to replace the batteries (so if communication is critical, I would replace them every two days). Around '1200 I dropped mine on accident and someone at the base found it the next day and radioed us, and he found my car so it could be returned to me. Apparently they are durable considering it survived a quarter mile fall with little more than a scratch. I like the simple lay out with the buttons, and the buttons are not horribly sensitive like I have experienced with other radios. I found them to be very effective for climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: The range is misleading in the description
customer_reviews.text: I am returning these. I'm sure they're great if your kids just want to use them around the house-- with each other. However, we bought them to use with a few other kids in the neighborhood. The description says, "Good up to 16 miles." So I thought I was good to go. What it fails to mention in the Amazon description, however, is that it's 16 miles from mountain to valley, and only good up to 1/2 mile in the neighborhood. The box very clearly states that, but the online description is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Abby Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Operating tips
customer_reviews.text: Here are some tips for using these radios. Battery life - you must use alkaline or lithium batteries, if you want good battery life (do not use standard carbon batteries). Range - not all 22 channels on the radio have the same power and range. If you want long distance communication use the high power channels and if you want longer battery life use the low power channels. Sound Quality - do not hold the radio close to your mouth when speaking.
customer_reviews.author: Brad L.

customer_reviews.title: No automatic shut off
customer_reviews.text: Everyone forgot to power down these radios. Within a few days, the batteries were dead. I had to put in new batteries, and the batteries died again. These radios really need to have an automatic turnoff. We stopped using them and they are collecting dust. Will throw them away...what a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader in N. NJ

customer_reviews.title: Use good batteries if the radio's will be used constantly as ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a total of (4) 3 packs and didn't have any issues. Were used during a music festival outdoors in a wooded area. We had no problems communicating from point A to point B anywhere at the facility. The longest distance being no more than a half mile. Use good batteries if the radio's will be used constantly as cheap batteries didn't last long on our high usage radios. Lower usage radio's didn't seem to be as bad on the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POOR RANGE (less than 0.5 mi) and not compatible with most other talkabouts
customer_reviews.text: Unless you're looking for a toy talkabout for play with your children who are going to be in your line of sight, you need to look for another unit. In reality, this set has the most limited range (less than 0.5mi) out of all Motorola talkabouts, despite marketed as up to 16 mi under most ideal condition (which means never). In most use cases you're not going to get more than 0.5-0.75 mi, which is a very short distance (couple blocks). In addition, it has no privacy code, which means while you can hear from other talkabouts (that has channel like 4-1, or 4-2 etc), they cannot hear you because you can only transmit at channel 4.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Good, but lock feature is useless.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set of walkie talkies for the money. Decent range and easy to use. However the main reason I bought this particular set was the ability to lock the keypad so that my young children wouldn't change the channel and render the devices useless. Unfortunately the lock feature is shared with the button that the kids play with most, the tone button. The kids are constantly changinging the channel by accident. They should have put more thought in to the lock feature.
customer_reviews.author: LasVegasReader

customer_reviews.title: Only works up to half mile away
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a birthday present for a family member. We tested them out a bunch. It is advirtised that they work up to 16 miles. They only work to about a half mile in distance then are extreamly static. After that they do not come in at all. Very disapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rory MacEachern

customer_reviews.title: SO-SO UNIT BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: INSIDE MY HOMES WORKS GREAT. BROUGHT THESE FOR ME AND MY 6 YEAR OLD GRANDSON. HE WAS VERY EXCITED USING IN THE HOUSE. TONIGHT HE WENT HOME (1.8 MILES AWAY) . GOT TO HIS ROOM AN TURNED THE TALKIE ON. ZILCH SIGNAL. THE PROMISED DISTANCE DID NOT EVEN COME CLOSE. WOULD HAVE RETURNED THEM. HE WANTED THEM STILL. WILL LOOK FOR A BETTER SET. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME ON THESE.
customer_reviews.author: antonio feliberti

customer_reviews.title: Great For A Cross Country Trip
customer_reviews.text: These were a life saver for us when we drove in separate vehicles cross country. Much easier than trying to text or call the other person. The down side was that the range was only 1/4 to 1/2 mile. I could see the other car behind me but we were to far apart to be able to communicate. The batteries in one unit died suddenly without any warning. I was hoping they would last for at least the three days we were driving. Overall they were very useful. Now I'll be using them on my ranch. Hopefully they can transmit and receive through the trees on my property.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Buy batteries at Costco or skip these
customer_reviews.text: Buy rechargeable. These go through batteries waaaaay too fast. Otherwise they are tiny and worked great. Just impossible to rely on given battery life.
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: I WISH I WOULD HAVE UPSIZED
customer_reviews.text: These should say Motorola radios for the tween. I only drove one-half of a mile away and the static was unbearable. It's a good thing this was meant for my neighbor. If you leave the radio on so you can hear the other talk, within one day, the batteries are dead and you have to replace. I like the bright pink, I like the durability thus far, but the ad should say if you are an adult, upsize!!
customer_reviews.author: Chester Lockwood

customer_reviews.title: I got these for camping, trail riding, etc ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for camping, trail riding, etc. to keep in touch, However they do not reach much further than I can yell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price but the clip sucks
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up use when going on off-roading trips with groups, and for that they have been fine. They were pretty cheap, at least I'll be Amazon warehouse, and considering what I paid for them I think they are a good deal, though while the clip/ battery compartment could be designed a bit better it's not a huge negative. I leave it in my console anyway so as not to hear all the people talking anyway. The only thing I would suggest to people considering these would be look at some that have a rechargeable battery built-in. Being able to swap batteries is convenient but it also kind of sucks having to carry extra.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: I op checked them and both worked out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I op checked them and both worked out of the box, so mission accomplished there. They are tiny little radios, but for $30 bucks and 16-mile range, why not throw them in an emergency kit? Definitely couldn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is a joke!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Battery life is a joke. You will spend more on batteries than the radios in the first month. In use maybe 8 hours and even on standby 40 hours at best. We needed to keep them and bought rechargeable batteries and a charger that cost far more than the radios themselves. Read reviews. More for the radio will save money down the road. These are an extremely poor value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons but overall worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Pros and cons with these... pros: good range, good volume and clarity, and the small size means they are easy to store in the vehicle door pocket or center console. Cons: that same small size can mean the button is hard to use as you hold the radio in your hand. Especially those with any dexterity issues from arthritis or other issue. Overall though I really like them. They replaced an old set that finally stopped working. We use them for parking our travel trailer at the camp site. Cell phones are an option except when there is no service which happens often with us.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: poor battery life!
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is so poor. Each walkie talkie contains 3 batteries. And 2 of them got their battery replaced. 15 batteries within a week of use is disappointing. I ordered this for my 6 year old brother because his dad got a covid and when we found out we took him right away before he catches it. This walkie talkie was a helpful tool for young kids esp when they're quarantined. Hes on his 1st week. He only used it when he needs food to be delivered and other stuff. I got disappointed when his walkie talkie ran out of battery so quick. I try to avoid getting close yet I ended up replacing his battery.
customer_reviews.author: Niewtidus AJ

customer_reviews.title: They're just ok
customer_reviews.text: The reason I gave a rating of 3 is because these radios are ok if you're looking for something really basic. I needed something with more features. Specifically, my son is in boy scouts. When we go camping it's for the weekend up to a whole week. The 2 main reasons in returning is because there isn't a battery indicator and it wasn't easy to change channels to link up to the radios other people had brought
customer_reviews.author: Kalani

customer_reviews.title: So fun and useful
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my kids to use around town, when spending time at a relative's house up the street or riding bikes to the park, etc. The kids love 'em, they are a blast to use. Honestly the range is more like 0.5-1 mi, perhaps due to local interference. Anything beyond that it gets really distorted. I am not a radio expert by any means. We live in a suburban area with a cell tower nearby.
customer_reviews.author: J. Elker

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for playing hide and seek outside and going hiking and it’s perfect. They aren’t those cheap little walkers that are noisy and don’t work. These work super good. Batter lift is not that long but looking into buying some rechargable batteries. The only think just like any other Wilkie is that it does pick up some signals here and there so sometimes you hear other people talking. My kids only use with while we supervise and when we hear other people we cha he channels. And they aren’t allowed to say adrrssses and or talk to any strangers.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Diggle

customer_reviews.title: Good to Let the Kids Roam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could talk to my kids while they are their friends' houses. It works great from inside my basement to their friends house about a quarter mile away, but it really starts losing signal after that. If you are outside you can get up to a half mile in a neighborhood with lots of houses, but it's no where near the stated distance. It works perfect for our use though. The clip is sturdy and my daughter attaches it to her bike pouch with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ben H.

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement
customer_reviews.text: This product was sold stating that he had a range of 16 miles. I walk to the end of my block and you cannot hear anything. Very upsetting.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Estevez

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Customer service phone number leads you on ...
customer_reviews.text: These radios chew through premium batteries in mere hours. I was planning to use these on a road trip. Imagine setting off with these only to be left high and dry. Terrible product. Customer service phone number leads you on a maze of other phone numbers and wait times. These radios do not deserve to exist. Shame on you Motorola.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Fernanda Chandoha

customer_reviews.title: used for work
customer_reviews.text: I need walkies at work that would not be mistaken for the regular black ones carried by the other workers. The pink casings fit the bill. They work fine; the sound is good; they are easy to use. The volume, on the lowest setting, is quite loud, though. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun family radios
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, simple radios. We used them partly to keep tabs on the kiddos while camping and around the neighborhood, but more just so they could have fun and talk to us and each other. The radios have a reasonable range (about a half mile or so in the woods, longer in the fields). It's long enough for the kids to have fun and wander away from each other. They won't replace an emergency whistle, obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Haon the GreatTop Contributor: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Good for outdoor
customer_reviews.text: Good for outdoors or in house. Lots of cement in office building? Nope but comes in hear n there. Still good. Belt clip broke but if you would see the chick who broke it you would say" damn!!!! She'd back up n break me for she got more bounce than an ounce" I'm still waiting on her to make it up to me lol
customer_reviews.author: Eric L Charron

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are FANTASTIC. My two kids are constantly playing at our pond and all over our land so a 3 pack was exactly what we needed! These have been so useful as they have been able to quickly tell me what they need, visit with me when they feel like it (just because they’re fun to use lol), and I can call them back home easily. They are clear, easy to use, and we just love them. I bought Amazon brand rechargeable batteries to use in them and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: ADVERTISED RANGE NOT ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: Like these but only good for about a half mile (at most) in a small rural development. Over open farm land,not much better. Good for jobsite but not a 200 acre farm. Good for around barns and house area,then dependent on phone. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product value
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after using borrowing my friend's unit during an early morning "spirited" group drive. Theses worked great with good range. They were very clear and bought the 3 pack for my family when we go on trail rides on our bikes. The range is shorter in the woods, as expected, but reasonable. These are much better than the walkie-talkie units of my youth. I wish these had the headphone jack. I like the small size and didn't want to get the larger model just for the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: MechE Terp

customer_reviews.title: Lucky to get 1 mile out of this "16 mile" range
customer_reviews.text: Got these to help pass the time with my kids while we're in COVID19 lockdown. Would do a run with 4yo in stroller and he would talk with his mom who was working at home. Barely made it to the park that is a half mile away. Beyond that is just noise. I figured 16 miles wasn't likely to happen, but thought we'd at least be able to talk a full mile away.... Probably just fine if you want to use them for a road trip and a caravan or if you're camping and staying near each other. Beyond that . . . somewhat useless.
customer_reviews.author: P. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Short Distance
customer_reviews.text: These were nice but distance not very good also shows in the pictures it has clips to put on a belt etc. but they did not. I would probably not purchase again as my son was only a couple of blocks away and we could not really hear him due to all the static.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for RV use
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for use with the RV. We can easily talk (when out of view) and they are small and clear. I have been using FRS radios since the Talkabout first came out. These are well worth the cost for good weather communication with 50-200yds.
customer_reviews.author: Reel-Lentless

customer_reviews.title: I really like these little guys
customer_reviews.text: I really like these little guys! They have great range, great sound, and do what I need them to do! My kids go out to a nearby park, or to a friend's house about a 1/4 mile from our place, and I can talk to them from home! Great walkies!!
customer_reviews.author: MacTheKnife

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, cheap battery safety clip
customer_reviews.text: Overall I gave this item three stars. It has great sound quality, great size for children, And the range is far enough to entertain preteens for quite a while. My only complaint is the battery compartment. Fresh out of the box the safety latch on the back broke the first time I was taking it off to put batteries in on two out of the three. Not a huge deal because it can always be taped back on just irritating that it was so cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: They work welll and are durable
customer_reviews.text: I use these to communicate with my kids as they move around the neighborhood playing with friends. They are durable and take a fair amount of abuse. I do like that they have both the low power family channels that save battery life, and the higher powered business channels that have a greater range. Using the business channels, they have an ouside range of about a mile. I do live in a more rural area so interference that can effect range is minimal. The only drawback that I have incountered is that they are not water proof or very water resistant. Two of them have died because they were left out in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff McNally

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice, works well.
customer_reviews.text: If you're buying these for playing around in your yard you should be good as long as you're not Bezos, because it will cover most yards. The range is good enough to keep track of other people in the woods up to about half a mile. You can buy as many of these as you want and connect them all to the same channel. Also, the battery life will likely last long enough for whatever you use it for, and the plastic seems to be very strong and sturdy. I've dropped these countless times and they haven't had a single hiccup, great for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: I like the color and design of the two way radio
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and design of the two way radio, and owning other communication device from Motorola I know they have a reputation of having high quality products. The material is made from good quality industrial plastic, not from a kids toy that after using once or twice it breaks, we dropped it a few times already and still works, no cracks or dings. In terms of distance, the reception is very good but we haven't tried it more than 1 mile, I would say 3-4 blocks. It very user friendly and the kids like it very much. If you ask me I believe I got a very good deal for an inexpensive two way radio.
customer_reviews.author: michael lim

customer_reviews.title: Its a great toy.  But still a toy.  Recommended for kids.  Adults could use something better.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 for a girls scout camping trip. The range is more like a block, perhaps two not "a few miles". Never trust the distance claims in these types of radios, Anything like the max distance is probably possible only between two dune tops in a desert with light of sight and perfect conditions. Otherwise.. divide the distance over 15 to get a better idea. On the plus side my daughters and their friends love them, they are pink, small for their smaller hands, light, and I won't feel bad if they get broken or die. They are inexpensive enough and have already gotten, in just two outings, my money's worth.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level radios
customer_reviews.text: These are great around a large yard or close in the campground. Our kids like being able to talk to us from inside the house to out the yard. This is an entry level product, the next level up the 200 series has rechargable batteries and a longer range, for just a little more money. Anyway this a great product for what it is, but range is 1/2 mile unless you are in the water or in a wide open space.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with excellent battery life
customer_reviews.text: These units are amazing for the price. Have used for 4 months and they are excellent. Battery life is perfect. I use rechargeable batteries and have no complaints. I have recharged the batteries once with normal use. The clarity is excellent, as are the operating buttons. Easy to use and figure out. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Does not particularly work in crowded areas
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my gf so we could just chat each other up from our apartments as we live relatively close. Does not work according to the distances listed but nevertheless, for the price the work great. You an use them inside the house and distances where you can see the person but cant yell loud enough to talk.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: OK for occasional use, but batteries are not included.
customer_reviews.text: I use several kinds of handheld radios in outdoor activities and for teaching electronics classes. I do like these little radios. They work as well as any of the FRS radios on Amazon. However, when you consider battery power, there are basically two kinds of handheld transceivers: ones with rechargeable battery packs and included chargers, and "batteries not included" ones that require your AAA batteries and have no built-in recharging option. These are the latter. For occasional use, these are OK. (Just remove the batteries between use to prevent damage from leakage.) If you use them a lot, you battery costs and inconvenience will be high. Consider radios with included rechargeable battery packs and USB chargers.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Phillips

customer_reviews.title: good for kids
customer_reviews.text: ordered these to use on our acreage with the kids. seem to work well - has a good range but we've had some trouble with other people being on the same channel and trying to talk to our kids.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old son got these for his birthday. All three of my boys run around the neighborhood with them. They are easy to use and the batteries are easy to change. Sound quality is good in a populated neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: J. Todd

customer_reviews.title: Burning up
customer_reviews.text: One arrived degraded - as soon as the batteries were inserted it got really hot pretty fast and the low battery indicator came on since it was draining the battery as fast as it could. Sent them back an bought Uniden instead.
customer_reviews.author: Moe Coffee

customer_reviews.title: Good little Walkie talkies
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with how well they are made. We purchased these to use to be able to communicate with each other while he pulled our horse trailer and I followed in my truck and we are very satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A.

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure about the range, but they worked a couple of rooms away. I was able to understand, but my Mom, who's hard-of-hearing, had a little trouble. These are walkie talkies. They are going to sound a bit grainy, due to the nature of the technology. I am satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: S P

customer_reviews.title: They seem to work fine, although..
customer_reviews.text: If you're not very good English reader you might miss the fact the distance they claim is from a hill over a valley. Also they don't come with batteries so you need 9 triple A's to go with these. Other than that, can't complain. They come with a loop for a lanyard which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J.

customer_reviews.title: Easy operation
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my granddaughters birthday. She is going to love them. I am writing this review because of so many complaints about changing the battery. It is SO simple. At the top of the belt clip there is a release clip. Mash it and remove the belt clip. Then at the bottom there is a release clip that looks like you could use a screw driver. Not needed. Just mash the release clip and the back comes right off. Insert or change the batteries. We have been playing with the walkie talkies and found them to be just what we were looking for. Can't wait to give them to my granddaughter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replace batteries often
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these a few weeks and we don't keep it on for very long, but the battery icon is constantly showing as low. When the battery is too low, you cannot talk but you can hear. I will test some different batteries or research if rechargeable batteries work with this product.
customer_reviews.author: nnjcustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift.  Work great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my nephew. He loves them. They play with them all over their house and neighborhood. Perfect for a 9 year old. They are very nice too. They were only a few more dollars than the kid toy ones so I thought I might as well get him something quality. These were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rae

customer_reviews.title: Great for Multi-Car Road Trip!!
customer_reviews.text: We did a 3-vehicle road trip from VA to MO to LA back to VA. We only had to change the batteries once in each walkie-talkie over a 10 day period. These walkie-talkies were awesome!! Each vehicle had an additional set of batteries and they were all easy to change on the fly.
customer_reviews.author: BTomblin

customer_reviews.title: Radius listed is false.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these specifically because the radius was listed to 16 miles. I figured even if it wasn't the full 16 I should be able to get at least 10 out of them. I tested them with family and literally the radius capped out at A HALF MILE. That's with no mountains or other major things that would disrupt the frequency. Super dissatisfied with these. The quality and sound appear fine but the range of communication is the most important aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G.

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so that my son and his cousin could enjoy them. Very easy to use and they love them. This set comes with a third so I check in on the fun. Really good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Whalen

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good, cheap, some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cheap for 3 of them Decent Range Sound quality is pretty good/ they get loud Cons: Battery life isnt the best...had to replace batteries 3 times over my road trip (25 hours) Unable to switch channel, so if someone else is talking on your channel, your SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Works with the old devices
customer_reviews.text: We had some of the older units lying around and we were able to make them work with these by switching the sub-channel on the old units to 0. It appears that these new one are missing the extra security features the old ones had, but it is workable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Fuller Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The poorest Motorola Product I have ever seen lor know about
customer_reviews.text: The one star rating is generous. A very well packaged pair of walkie ta;lires, and the quality disappeared when the units were unwrapped. The instructions are poorly written and printed in a font so small they must hope you never try to read them. the battery loading is tight--but it was the only thing that worked on either unit. the buttons dis not work as advertised on either unit.' one began a "ticking" when the batteries were installed and never quit unless a battery was removed. We will buy another set of walkie talkies, but it will be from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Hall

customer_reviews.title: Poor range
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for camping/hunting trip. This was up in the mountains, I wanted to be able to stay in touch with the wife while I was out hunting. The range was very, very poor. I would be maybe 1/2 mile from camp with some tree cover in between and could barely even use these. I bought them because I have a 20 year old motorola talkabout that has always worked great up there. These new ones just aren't the same. More of a toy then a decent walkie talkie.
customer_reviews.author: jesse44

customer_reviews.title: They can not be let turned on because it eats the battery life quickly
customer_reviews.text: It is very unconfortable to have to put on new batteries every time you use them. I had to turn them off while not in use in order to keep the battery life a bit more. Test 1, I put new batteries on sunday, used them during that day, let them on just to whatch battery life and they died on wednesday. Test 2, I put new batteries on sunday, used them during that day and turned them off. Turned them on saturday and they worked fine. Turned them off when finished and turned them on again next weekend, they work well too. Conclusion: you cant leave them on when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: These radios made a cross-country move with two vehicles so much easier. Range isn't as far as advertised but that is probably the only complaint. 10-4, rubber ducky!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to be able to communicate with my wife around the house. It worked perfectly except we had trouble with the high volume and was not able to get it to work quietly to suit her. I also don't see it to be useful for hunting because the noise it makes would drive the game away from my area.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: Great for 4.5 year old
customer_reviews.text: My mom gave these to my 4.5 year old son as a gift. They were smaller than we expected, but that’s OK. They fit into his pocket. Great sound quality and pretty easy to use, event for my little guy. I can’t comment on battery life because we haven’t had them too long. Overall satisfied and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Little Walkie Talkies...
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. I bought the three pack to us with RV parking and for my kids to play with. The range is great, they are well built and very simple to use. They are also very compact. If you need a simple to operate set of radios that just work, then these are highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Spicoli

customer_reviews.title: Great range!
customer_reviews.text: These have great range! We bought for our son as he is at that age where he needs a little independence to ride his bike to his friends and this gives me the peace of mind to stay in contact with him. We also took on vacation for my husband and I to talk to each other when we ran back and forth from the beach to the house to grab snacks, etc. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: E. Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Good walkie talkies for rv and mountain bike communication
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought these for backing up our trailer so we didn't have to worry about service or having phones charged. We also started using it while mountain biking and I found the range to be pretty impressive. I have not had them long enough to comment on battery life but I like that they are battery powered because I hate having to charge a million things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but an issue with one of them.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great except for two things. I have the set of three. One of the radios is very glitchy when you hit PTT. And the belt clip on the other radio doesn’t snap into place so it keeps coming off. I dunno, will try to troubleshoot again...
customer_reviews.author: Seth Lyall

customer_reviews.title: False advertising on the range. 16 miles? More like 16 feet.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t reach 2 blocks. Lies. I was on flat surface and the walkies couldn’t reach even 500 feet away or so. False advertisement. I ordered 2 packs and screwed now. What? I’ll talk to my cat in my house?
customer_reviews.author: Shay Bstein

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Kids LOVE these, they're easy to use and we had so much fun with them we bought them for the neighbors and they all have a blast. They can be loud so I often have them play outside with them. And we look forward to using them when we're camping, skiing and playing outdoors. We did have to teach them other people can listen into the conversations and to be careful what they share - they've been very respectful.
customer_reviews.author: CAPN

customer_reviews.title: No batteries last in these
customer_reviews.text: No matter what batteries I buy for these they do not last more than 2 hours. I do not recommend buying!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: The best low key way to communicate. Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use while backing up our travel trailer. Nice to have quiet guidance from my wife instead of yelling directions to me. Less stressful and probably appreciated by the surrounding campers.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon  W.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and function but up to 16 miles, well that’s definitely not true. We got them for multiple car traveling. We couldn’t get 1/4 mile apart without loosing each other or couldn’t understand each other. In town/out of town and in wide open areas. Don’t waste your money. I should have just bought another ham radio, which I ended up doing anyway. Much better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Major

customer_reviews.title: Basic
customer_reviews.text: Probably good for kids. Bought this for work where my guys are generally within a block or so. Range was not good and material is just plastic. No rubber for grip. Returned and decided to just step up for a professional one.
customer_reviews.author: y2says

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: These work for what I need them for. The battery life using Energizer batteries only lasted 4/5 days depending on use. We used them for about twenty minutes twice a day and about 45min once a day. That's just allot of batteries to go through. I will be looking in to reusable batteries for future use.
customer_reviews.author: blayzeh02

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Great product, shipped on time. I used them for communication in a construction site, and the range was great on the same floor. If I was more than 2 floors away it was hard to understand what everyone was saying. Battery life was around 6 hours of constant use and different locations. Overall they worked well for what I was looking for and would definitely work in open areas but be careful with inside a building.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These work great and have wonderful range. But the downfall is they drain the batteries and no time. We only use them a couple times and I got tired of buying batteries for them so we stopped using them.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Nau

customer_reviews.title: Simple. easy. clear.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. clear voice quality. The only weird thing is that the clip needs to be removed to replace the battery, but that is no big deal for me. Nice a small design easy to fit on a purse or pocket.
customer_reviews.author: JoJoNeNe

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine lifesavers
customer_reviews.text: These have been quarantine lifesavers!! When the kids get bored I tell them to play with the walkie-talkies! When I get bored I turn on a channel and listen in on the neighbor lol Fun for The Whole Family!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: receiving range is way over stated
customer_reviews.text: Just received. I think a mile range for reception is pushing it. Flat land with no obstructions in our area and a mile was still spotty with static. No way you are going to get something for distances any more than one mile. Over promises and under delivers on advertising. We forewarned!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: It says it works up to 16 miles but it doesn't even work at 3 miles
customer_reviews.text: It says it works up to 16 miles but the range is WAY less than that. I'm not sure where the threshold is but it definitely doesn't work at 3 miles. I'm really disappointed about this because i bought it so my daughter could talk with friends during the quarantine and it's not possible (yes, even when they're both outside). I'd return it but I threw out the packaging once I tried it around my property. all that said, it's a quality build. The sound is clear as long as you don't put your mouth right next to the mic.
customer_reviews.author: KEN

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: we bought two sets (4) for birthday gifts for our grsndchild and a neighbor grandson. three of them work very well but One would not turn on. too bad for us and our grandson the return window has closed.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price/size
customer_reviews.text: For the size and price these are great. Battery life is as good as 3 AAA batteries can be and the sound is okay for a tiny speaker. These are the last of a generation with a build date of 09.19 because these are now not allowed to be produced according to the FCA. Works great for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob

customer_reviews.title: What happened to the Motorola I knew?
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed. No coverage in small town 1 mile apart. Works inside the home, and from home to yard. Got these for my children for Christmas as they are really quite sad about it.
customer_reviews.author: Book Gnome

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reception!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a toy for my 4 year old and it ended up my hisband and I use them. We took them camping, bikie riding, even used them to help him back up the R.V. They work very good, not like the toy ones for kids that dont work... I would definitely buy them again!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: They were supposed be a twenty mile range, with a terrain disclaimer. My grandkids live 5.8 miles away from us and will not work. We live on top of hill in suburban area, no y’all buildings blocking. I expected them to work at least 10 miles. Such a disappointment for all of us, for I am immune compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: It’s small and compact and easy to use. My only problem is the battery goes dead every week. I do 40 hours/wk standby time with maybe 2 hours of that in actual talk use. Maybe if it had rechargeable batteries I would have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Rodger Dodger
customer_reviews.text: Rodger: Can you hear me Dodger, over? Dodger: Rodger Rodger. Dodger out, over. Dodger: Let's rendezvous in the kitchen for some cookies, over! Rodger: Rodger Dodger, Rodger out, over.
customer_reviews.author: wxydesign

customer_reviews.title: NO---QR CODE
customer_reviews.text: Need to return set....one is defective dont work at all....NEED RETURN LABEL & CANT CONTACT AMAZON....PLEASE MAIL ME A RETURN BACK TO U LABEL.....QR CODE DONT WORK FOR UPS....RETURNS, UPDATE UR SITE HOW TO GET A LABEL. THANK U
customer_reviews.author: Sherre

customer_reviews.title: The family loves them!
customer_reviews.text: This has brightened up my children's world. They use them indoors, outdoors and when we're out and about. Given them a reason to mask up and go out & play, something they've had little motivation to do since shelter-in-place.
customer_reviews.author: The Spellers

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a set that also had GMRS and these work fine. Good price point. I also wanted something that took simple batteries such as AA or AAA - I camp and I don't want yet more proprietary batteries and special chargers to haul with me, and these each take 3 AAA's.
customer_reviews.author: Enzo

customer_reviews.title: 16 miles is far!
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I’ve never used walkie talkies other than random things for work. My husband bought these to play around with at home while we are quarantined and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: boyMom

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gag gift for my parents' anniversary (because marriage is 90% yelling "WHAT?" from other rooms). We use the same product where I work. Surprisingly, they really like them for using around the house and yard. I like the alert button because my dad is allergic to bee stings, and it's loud enough to get a neighbor's attention if he gets stung. If you are looking for an easy to use, durable set of walkie-talkies, these are a great option for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

product_meta.title: Motorola T100 Talkabout Radio, 2 Pack
product_meta.description: Style:T100| Pattern Name:RadioKeeping the family together. Simple, compact and easy-to-use by the entire family, The T100 is the perfect way to stay in touch when out and about, whether at the playground, hiking in the park or enjoying a picnic. This colorful two-way radio has a range of up to 16 miles and features 22 channels, Providing you with just what you need to instantly reach your family and friends, and know they’re safe. The T100 is available in a twin-pack or triple-pack. How far can I expect My radios to communicate? The communication range quoted is calculated based on an unobstructed line of sight test under optimum conditions. Actual range will vary depending on terrain and conditions, and is often less than the maximum possible. Your actual range will be limited by several factors including, but not limited to: terrain, weather conditions, electromagnetic interference, and obstructions.
feature_bullets: Included Components: 2 Radios, 2 Belt Clips, 1 User Guide

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,799 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
